title: No lawsuit completed on illegal pyramid schemes determined by CB: Governor raises concerns
byline: The law enforcement authorities are yet to complete any law suit with regard to some 20 illegal pyramid schemes which were determined by the Central Bank to have been engaged in illegal activities under the Banking Act, Central Bank governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said.

title: UNP will be SJB  partner soon: Mujibur
byline: While highlighting that talks between his party and United National Party (UNP) has been a  success, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Mujibur Rahman said today that the UNP will soon become a partner of the SJB.

title: Mavai Senathirajah hospitalised
byline: Mavai Senathirajah, the leader of the Ilankai Thamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) politburo and former Member of Parliament, has been hospitalised.

title: India lodges strong protest over Sri Lanka Navy firing on Indian fishermen
byline: India’s Ministry of External Affairs has lodged a strong protest following an incident in which the Sri Lanka Navy opened fire when apprehending Indian fishermen in Sri Lankan waters.

title: New opening combination confirmed as Australia lock in top-order for Sri Lanka
byline: Stand-in captain Steve Smith confirmed on the eve of the opening Test that Travis Head will open for Australia against Sri Lanka in Galle.

title: Education Ministry calls for report on Jaffna University academic staff’s TU action: Nalinda
byline: The Education Ministry has called for a report on the trade union action launched by the academic staff of the Jaffna University, Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: LG polls in April, EC to announce date: Nalinda
byline: The Local Government elections will be held in April and the  Elections Commission will announce the date soon, Cabinet spokesman, Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Johann Peries - first Sri Lankan to summit tallest mountain in Antarctica
byline: Johann Peries summits the tallest mountain in Antarctica - Mount Vinson - at 4,892 metres, to become the first Sri Lankan to achieve the feat, sources said.

title: Two illegal Indian boatmen wounded in Navy shooting at KKS
byline: At least two Indian fishermen sustained gunshot injuries and 11 others were arrested during a confrontation with the Sri Lanka Navy in seas off Kankesanthirai early this morning, when the Navy tried to seize an unruly crew of Indian poachers, police said.

title: Coconut Triangle faces marshland threat due to illegal sand washing
byline: The coconut triangle in the country risks turning into marshland in the near future due to the operation of illegal sand washing plants in the region.

title: Sri Lanka to procure 28 garbage compactors from Japan’s 300 Mn Yen grant
byline: The Government of Japan has agreed to provide a grant of 300 million Yen to Sri Lanka at the request of the Sri Lankan government, for the procurement of 28 garbage compactors to enhance waste management efforts under the ’Clean Sri Lanka’ programme.

title: Jaffna University academic staff on strike
byline: The academic staff of the Jaffna University has resorted to a trade union action on five demands, including stern disciplinary action against the misdemeasnour of the students.

title: Hand grenades recovered at Beliatta Temple
byline: An investigation was launched after two hand grenades were found at a temple in Beliatta, Tangalle.

title: Special commodity levy on dates slashed to Rs. 1
byline: The special commodity levy on dates has been reduced from Rs. 200 to Rs. 1, effective from today (28) until March 31, 2025.

title: New chairpersons appointed for three Parliamentary committees
byline: Deputy Minister Harshana Suriyapperuma has been elected as the new Chair of the Committee on Ways and Means of Parliament while Minister Chrishantha Abeysena was elected as the new Chair of the Committee on Ethics and Privileges.

title: NCPA receives 580 sexual abuse complaints in 2024
byline: The National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) received a total of 8,746 complaints regarding child protection issues in 2024, with 580 related to incidents of sexual abuse alone.

title: Overall economy remains severely damaged: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said even though surface-level indicators may suggest economic recovery, the overall economy in Sri Lanka remains severely damaged.

title: Sri Lanka seeks stronger regional cooperation on transnational crimes
byline: Ambassador and Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka in Bangkok, E.A.S. Wijayanthi Edirisinghe held discussions with Co-Manager – Australia, Regional Support Office of Bali Process (RSO), David Scott and senior officials of the Bali Process on People Smuggling, Trafficking in Persons, and Related Transnational Crime.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa’s body should be preserved after death; Former Dy. Speaker
byline: Former Deputy Speaker Ajith Rajapakshe has called for the preservation of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s body for public display after his demise.

title: Former Presidents’ pensions cannot be touched under Constitution, Gammanpila argues
byline: In the wake of debate on the proposed curtailment of perks and privileges of former Heads of State, Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) leader Udaya Gammanpila added to further controversy in this regard when he said their pensions could not be reduced or scrapped according to the Constitution and universal legal principles.

title: UK Minister for Indo-Pacific in Sri Lanka
byline: Inclusive economic growth, anti-corruption, human rights and national reconciliation are on the agenda as Catherine West, Minister for Indo-Pacific will meet key government ministers.

title: IMEI devices must be registered with TRCSL from today
byline: Colombo, January 28 (Daily Mirror) - Any radio frequency (RF) emitting devices, including those requiring International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) registration, will not be permitted to operate unless registered with the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) effective from today (28), TRCSL Director General Air Vice Marshal Bandula Herath said.

title: President Dissanayake sets ambitious export target of US $ 36bn by 2030
byline: Sri Lanka’s export fraternity must intensify efforts to diversify its markets and product basket as President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has directed the industries and officials to work towards achieving an ambitious export revenue target of US $ 36 billion by 2030.

title: Merchandise exports anchor US $ 12.7bn revenue in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka’s export sector ended 2024 on a positive note, with merchandise exports reaching US $ 12.7 billion, reflecting a 6.67 percent growth year-on-year (YoY).

title: Week begins in green
byline: The ASPI closed in green as a result of price gains in counters such as Melstacorp, Lanka IOC and Bukit Darah with the turnover crossing Rs. 5.9 Bn.

title: Sri Lanka and Australia renew rivalry at Galle
byline: Sri Lanka and Australia will renew their rivalry in a two-Test home series starting tomorrow at the Galle Stadium.

title: Loss making state owned companies to be listed in CSE
byline: A study is being conducted on how to list loss-making State Owned Enterprises (SOEs) in the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) via a holding company, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake revealed today.

title: Cases filed against Aragalaya activists; Govt. to provide reasonable solution: Minister
byline: Claiming that there is an issue in filing cases with regard to Aragalaya activists who were arrested during the Aragalaya time, Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said the government will intervene to provide them with a reasonable solution.

title: Economic Transformation Act will be amended: President
byline: The government expects to implement the Economic Transformation Act with amendments, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Justice will prevail: Namal responds to Krrish case indictment
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa has expressed confidence in the judiciary following the Attorney General’s decision to file an indictment against him in connection with the Krrish Company case.

title: Don’t hold grudges against people: SLPP MP
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) government should not hold grudges against people but should focus on bringing a real system change, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP D.V. Chanaka said.

title: President’s Fund to allocate further support for Students
byline: The Board of Governors of the President’s Fund convened today (28) at the Presidential Secretariat, where one of the key topics discussed was expanding educational support for students, particularly those preparing for the G.C.E. Ordinary Level and Advanced Level examinations.

title: Veteran journalist Lakshman Jayawardene passes away
byline: Veteran journalist Lakshman Jayawardene who has been involved with the media for  a long period passed away today.

title: My father would have won Nobel Peace Prize if he had signed MOU with LTTE: Namal
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa would have won the Nobel Peace Prize if he had signed an MOU with the LTTE but he did what he had to do, Sri Lanka  Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa said today.

title: Poor air quality due to polluted air from India: NBRO
byline: Referring to the air quality in many parts of having reached unhealthy levels, the National Building Research Organization (NBRO) said the poor air quality is caused by polluted air originating from India as well as locally generated pollutants.

title: Luxury vehicles, with parts removed, abandoned at Srawasthi Mandiraya
byline: A fleet of luxury vehicles at the Srawasthi Mandiraya in Colombo 7 has been parked there by the Presidential  Secretariat, an official from Parliament said. The luxury vehicles are however in a very bad condition with most of the vehicle parts removed.
